description.narrative:
The Institute for Studies of Society, Economics and Environment (iSEE) is a science and technology organization that coordinates the People participation working group (PPWG) which was established in 1999. It is an informal network that acts as a forum for organisations and professionals - such as donors, government employees, NGOs, project managers, consultants and researchers to exchange information and ideas on issues relating to people#s participation, grassroots democracy and civil society .
In recent years, PPWG has been an active group to do awareness raising and advocacy for policies and legislation towards enlarging civil society space in Vietnam such as advocacy for amendment of Constitution 2013, Law on Law, Law on Access to Information, Law on Association and Decree 93 on management and utilisation of foreign non-governmental aid. Through its work, PPWG also strengthens cooperation among differentcivil society actors and increase the public understanding and support for a necessary role of civil society in Vietnam. However, PPWG currently plans its work and strategies on annual basis. Its resource is dependent on ad-hoc contribution from its members. Its chair is leading PPWG voluntarily and its coordinator is a full-time staff of iSEE # the current coordinating member of PPWG. This current arrangement constrains PPWG to take more strategic role in increasing people#s participation in policy making, social debate,advocacy and enlarging civil society space in Vietnam.
Oxfam has been anactive steering committee member of the PPWG since it established in 1999, we also acted as the chair of the group during 2005 - 2006. Recently, together with iSEE, Oxfam has lead and contribute to PPWG#s thematic working groups on Law on Association andDecree 93 on management and utilization of non-governmental aid. Facilitate enabling environment for Civil Society especially ensuring rights to access to information and to association is a strategicintervention that clearly define in the OCS to 2019 andVCG1 strategy in coming year. It also links to several the current Oxfam#s programmes/projects (the coalition programme, budget transparency..etc..). Therefore, we see the need and added value for Oxfam to continue to support PPWG in advocacy efforts.
iSEE joining this project with the aims to support PPWG to increase its institutional and financial capabilities to take a strategic and leading role in civil society development in Vietnam and carrying out advocacy forenabling

participating-org.narrative: Institute for Studies of Society, Economy and Environment

The Institute for Studies of Society Economy and Environment (iSEE) was established in 2007. iSEE now has since grown into an organisation with clear vision, mission and defined strategies to support ethnic minorities, LGBT and people who live with HIV in its owndistinctive ways. Its mission: iSEE is a non-profit Vietnamese organisation that commits itself to protecting the human rights of minorities and the socially excluded. Its institutional objectives are to envision a prosperous, diverse, democratic and just Vietnamese society where minorities are treated equally, and where human rights are fulfilled and protected; to aim to becoming a leading think tank in the field of rights of minorities and the socially excluded in Vietnam. Given the current situation of inequality and exclusion and the level of rights denied, iSEE targets its efforts to the following groups: ethnic minorities; lesbian women, gay men, bi-sexual and transgender people; and people living with HIV (focus on ethnic minorities andgay men in the closet).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

receiver-org.narrative: Institute for Studies of Society, Economy and Environment
